html.p: Definition. The standard matrix for the identity transformation [mathjaxinline]T: \mathbb R^ n \rightarrow \mathbb R^ n[/mathjaxinline] is denoted by the symbol [mathjaxinline]I_ n[/mathjaxinline] and is called the [mathjaxinline]n\times n[/mathjaxinline] identity matrix. Often we simply use [mathjaxinline]I[/mathjaxinline] to denote the identity matrix when the [mathjaxinline]n[/mathjaxinline] is understood.

Since [mathjaxinline]I_ n[/mathjaxinline] is the standard matrix for the identity transformation [mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline], we have [mathjaxinline]I_ n v = T(v) = v[/mathjaxinline] for all [mathjaxinline]v\in \mathbb R^ n[/mathjaxinline].
